reviewText: Christopher Atkins and Roddy McDowall (THE LEGEND OF HELL HOUSE, FRIGHT NIGHT) star in SHAKMA! SHAKMA is a baboon, given an experimental brain serum to reduce aggression. Unfortunately, it doesn't appear to have worked very well, as the creature goes berserk in the lab! As a result, Professor Sorenson (McDowall) orders his student, Sam (Atkins) to put SHAKMA down, which he -shockingly- doesn't do. Of course, SHAKMA escapes, slaughters all of the other research animals, and no one is safe. Locked in for a night of treasure hunt-type games, Sorenson and his students are unwittingly trapped w/ the beast, and it's not at all happy! These game-players are in for a long, bloody night. SHAKMA is a decent horror movie, though it's fairly obvious where it's all headed from the beginning. Personally, I find baboons to be scary as hell, so this one got me! Yikes! Co-stars Amanda Wyss (A NIGHTMARE ON ELM STREET) as Tracy...

reviewText: St Augustine Spring Break of 1993, 7 girls 5 seniors and 2 sophomores in a condominium beachside.  I go to rent a movie and go right for the horror section. I see a cover with a crazed Baboon with red eyes on it,"Shakma", and I just felt compelled to grab it. We all got nice and liquored up like good spring breakers, sat down on the floor and couch and put it in. The premise of the movie is simple, there is a lab where animals are experimented on, a group of students and a professor decide to play some kind of dungeons and dragon's type game after hours complete with clues, and keys and walkie talkies and a princess to rescue at the end. One of the students (Christopher Atkins who is looking pretty haggard) has a favorite test animal Shakma, a baboon that was just operated on by the professor(Roddy McDowall playing himself), and it "went wrong" and this monkey turns on the lab assistants and they have to "put him under" much to Christopher Atkins dismay apparently he has bonded with Shakma, who by the way carries around a stuffed animal, and he had "almost tamed him" maybe he was making Shakma watch "the blue lagoon" and Brooke shields tan firm body calmed the primate. The students, who are a motley group of people complete with the "nerd, smart girl, pretty girl, hero, normal guy and jerk" The game involves going from floor to floor, solving puzzles to get clues, calling the professor up on walkie talkies to ask for keys, I couldn't for the life of me figure the game out and the point of it, I never did play any of those role playing games, because I wasn't a giant nerd. So Shakma, who is supposed to be dead, isn't (no big spoiler there) and proceeds to tear apart the Nerds one by one, and it's flipping creepy, because he is running and skipping and his hair is all fabulous and huge like Tina Turner in Mad Max: Thunderdome, He has a huge red hiney, and I have to point this out but he has a monkey boner the entire movie, slow the film down and you will not be able to miss it, seriously Shakma is the Ron Jeremy of monkeyland. Chris Atkins figures it all out, and hunts down Shakma  I won't give the end away, but it was pretty unusual for a 1990s film . All in all there are some horrifying terrifying moments with the baboon, I don't know what they did to the poor thing to piss it off but Shakma was not "acting", I am sure the animal rights people were going nuts when this came out. It's hard to find, I had to get a DVD from the UK and the transfer was laughable, I found mine on EBay, Amazon only has the VHS.  I have to admit It was the best part of spring break (no hot tubs or girls gone wild for us christian school girls, only wine coolers and horror movies!), we watched it about 5 times, and when we see each other now, we STILL talk about how we all squealed and hugged the pillows.

reviewText: Shakma is one of the ultimate video cheapies but it's actually a good video cheapie. A medical professor (Roddy McDowell) and a group of med students are playing a Dungeons & Dragons-like role playing game inside their school on a weekend where they are the only ones inside & locked in to boot. Over the course of a night they are attacked & killed, one by one, by a test baboon (Shakma) that was supposed to have been put to sleep earlier in the day but was given the wrong drug which increased his aggresive tendencies tenfold. Shakma, now homicidal, rips apart his victims in a grisly and realistic fashion. The movie is helped largely by the fact that they used a real baboon in most of the movie. Very effective. Also stars Christopher Atkins, Amanda Wyss (A Nightmare on Elm Street), & Ari Meyers (Kate & Allie).
